1113854611721531394.text:
You default, the middleman takes your collateral OR if validated through "unorthodox" income history, charges a premium on par with the perceived risk they're taking

You could get really creative with the arrangements.

1113854610911969280.text:
Imagine a middleman who accepts almost anything as collateral (art, crypto, car, illiquid assets, etc) or does due diligence on "unorthodox" income history to determine riskiness

The renter makes the payments. The middleman takes on default risk.

1113854610001801216.text:
In a world of contractors, gig workers, unique employment arrangements, apartments STILL ask for monthly income and employer on the rental application.

Then they ask for a paystub as proof.

This is beyond outdated.

1113854609301360642.text:
A less than ideal apt hunt due to a non-traditional income structure between me & my SO gave me an idea.

A middleman between the renter and the real estate company who takes on default risk by accepting alternative forms of income or collateral.

Does anything like this exist?
